passage.title: He's right
passage.paragraph: Da Ming rides his bike to go to school. He puts it in the yard of the school. There are many bikes there. After shcool, the students take their bikes and go home by bike. Sometimes a policeman stops them all and lets the cars go by. Some students carry heavy bags of books with them. One day, Da Ming and Li Lei are on one bike. The policeman stops them. Li Lei is angry. "I'm tired. Let us go!" he shouts at the policeman. "Don't shout at him." Da Ming says, "He's right."
